summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from December 2019, primarily regarding travel approval requests for a team conducting interviews in connection with the Epstein investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to Los Angeles, CA, and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, FL, for victim/witness interviews, with mentions of specific team members and logistical arrangements like flights and hotel conference rooms.

persons.name: Alleyne
persons.context: Appears as a recipient or cc'd individual on multiple travel approval request emails related to the Epstein investigation, suggesting involvement in the legal or administrative process.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: A team planned to travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or possibly multiple interviews) in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: A team planned to travel to Los Angeles for an interview in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: A team member planned to travel to West Palm Beach for an interview in connection with the Epstein investigation, with a request to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: A team planned to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in connection with the Epstein investigation, with a request to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: A team planned to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with victims in connection with the Epstein investigation, with a request to reserve a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: A team planned to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in connection with United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in Florida
events.description: Two individuals requested permission to travel for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document references an active investigation titled 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity' as of March-November 2019.
Multiple trips were planned by a prosecution/investigative team to Los Angeles and Florida (West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale) specifically to conduct victim and witness interviews.

Logistical details include specific flight itineraries (e.g., Delta from JFK to LAX, JetBlue return), hotel preferences (DoubleTree Santa Monica), and frequent requests to reserve hotel conference rooms for interviews.

The emails show coordination and approval processes within the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) for investigative travel, indicating ongoing case work after Epstein's 2019 arrest.
Several team member initials are referenced (e.g., 'M', 'S') but are not fully named, and the primary named individual is 'Alleyne', who is cc'd on administrative requests.
